snippet: The decision, just a month before a peace conference that will seek an end to the grinding civil war in Syria, demonstrated again the frustrations of trying to cultivate a viable alternative to President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Obama administration decides to suspend delivery of nonlethal aid to moderate opposition in Syria; decision, just a month before a peace conference that will seek an end to country's grinding civil war, demonstrates again the frustrations of trying to cultivate a viable alternative to Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON, MARK LANDLER and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon and Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The decision, just a month before a peace conference that will seek an end to the grinding civil war in Syria, demonstrated again the frustrations of trying to cultivate a viable alternative to President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: U.S. Suspends Nonlethal Aid to Syria Rebels
headline.print_headline: U.S. Suspends Nonlethal Aid to Syria Rebels

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
